intro: Antidesma montis-silam, commonly known as the Silam mountain antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, which are typical of many species in its family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
